column4: looks like you have some old updates that didn't finish properly.. go into a terminal and run this "sudo apt-get install"..
when i try it i get this error http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/45986
ok.. seems like it's cupsys that's being naughty.. try this.. "sudo dpkg-reconfigure cupsys"
I would try that now
this is what i get http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/45987/
ok.. we'll try removing it and installing it again then.. "sudo apt-get install --reinstall cupsys" , see if that works
still i get an error http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/45988/
last try then.. we add a --purge "sudo apt-get install --reinstall --purge cupsys"
No way, still i get the same error
ok.. let's check some logs.. see if they will tell us someting.. "tail /var/log/syslog".. anything there about cupsys?
Here it is http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/45989/
nothing there about cupsys... hang on.. I'll see if we can't make apt-get tell us a little more about what is going wrong
ok

nope.. didn't find anything.. what happened is this... something went wrong with the update of cupsys (handles printing in linux), apt-get get's the error message and then assumes that cupsys isn't installed properly so every time you install something it will try to isntall cupsys again.. since it's still in the to-do-queue
you could try removing cupsys altogether.. using the --purge switch.. and then reinstall it. but I'm not sure that would work either
Anyway im not using any printing media with my system, would it be a problem if i remove it completely and how to do that
nope.. no problem.. to remove it you run "sudo apt-get remove --purge cupsys"
I get a warning " dpkg - warning: while removing cupsys, directory `/etc/cups/ssl' not empty so not removed."
that's alright.. cupsys probably installed some files there.. it's no big deal
Thanks for your kind help :)
you're welcome
